page.title: 05TOURISM IN DEEPCAR/WORTLEY
page.content: There is much potential in the area particularly in 4 related subjects: ancient history, heritage trails, industrial archaeology and nature trails. 3 locally-written booklets provide further information: "10 WALKS AROUND STOCKSBRIDGE"(South Yorks.C.C.) "15 WALKS AROUND WORTLEY"(J.A.Barstow) "HISTORY OF STOCKSBRIDGE"(J.Branston). {ANCIENT HISTORY:}Mesolithic tool site, quern 'factory'(QUERN CLIFF{]}WHARN- CLIFFE), Roman pottery and cupola, ancient settlements. {INDUSTRIAL ARCHAEOLOGY:}Remains still in evidence for corn mill, gannister brick works, coal mining, Tin Mill and water wheel, clay mines, lead mining, sandstone quarry for glassmaking, chemical works, and Blacking Mill ('black lead' for Yorkshire Ranges). Many railway features (esp. stations and signalbox) still exist.
